thread.title: A vengeful Mick and Ronnie team up to get rid of bad boy Dean in EastEnders
thread.title_full: A vengeful Mick and Ronnie team up to get rid of bad boy Dean in EastEnders

title: A vengeful Mick and Ronnie team up to get rid of bad boy Dean in EastEnders
text:
A vengeful Mick and Ronnie team up to get rid of bad boy Dean in EastEnders A vengeful Mick and Ronnie team up to get rid of bad boy Dean in EastEnders 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Mick Carter (played by Danny Dyer) and Ronnie Mitchell (Samantha Womack) will join forces to eliminate a mutual enemy. 
It looks like we’ll be saying farewell to Matt Di Angelo’s Dean Wicks, especially as the actor’s EastEnders exit has been confirmed. 
On the face of it, the two Walford residents don’t have much in common, but they do have their own reasons for wanting bad boy Dean to disappear. Talk about a deadly alliance. Ronnie and Mick form a deadly alliance in EastEnders (BBC) 
In the case of the Queen Vic landlord, it’s very personal: Dean, Mick’s little brother, raped his wife Linda. 
A traumatised Linda became pregnant shortly after the assault, but she wasn’t ready to reveal her ordeal to anyone, including her husband. 
The truth eventually came out on Christmas Day in 2014. Linda went on to give birth to son Ollie, and was relieved when the child’s father was confirmed as Mick – not Dean. Dean Wicks played by Matt Di Angelo (BBC) 
But, so far, Dean has escaped punishment for his heinous act. 
Roxy Mitchell is dating Dean, and big sister Ronnie doesn’t approve. She knows he’s a wrong ‘un, but attempts to convince her sibling to drop him have been unsuccessful. EastEnders resident Roxy Mitchell (Rita Simons) 
Struggling to control his emotions, a determined Mick meets with Ronnie and the pair confirm the details of their plan to get rid of Dean. 
Will Mick be able to go through with it? Share article 
This episode will air on November 2. Promoted Stories
